bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

sense.def: Pathological Condition that primarily have their onset in autumn. Qian jin bei ji fang 千金備急方 and Pu ji fang 普濟方 : 胃而有毛曰秋 病 , “If the stomach [movement in the vessels] is hair-like, this is called ‘ autumn disease ’”. In contrast: Ben cao gang mu 本草綱目 Si shi yong yao li 四時用藥例 , examples of using pharmaceutical drugs in the course of the four seasons: 春得秋病 , 夏得冬病 , 神 而明之 , 機而行之 , 變通權宜 , 又不可泥一也 , “If in spring one gets an autumn disease , if in summer one gets a winter disease, one must do everything to understand this, and act flexibly and do what is expedient. It would be wrong to cling to just one principle”.
